tmpls.name: Card 1

fields: What is few-shot learning in NLP?

Definition: Learn new tasks with very few examples
Approach: Use pre-trained models + prompt engineering
Examples: GPT-3 with task descriptions in prompts
Benefits: Rapid adaptation, minimal task-specific data

Definition: Design input prompts to elicit desired behavior
Techniques: Few-shot examples, instruction tuning
Importance: Can dramatically affect model performance
Challenges: Brittle, model-dependent, hard to optimize
What are common biases in NLP models?

Gender bias: Associating professions with genders
Racial bias: Different sentiment for different groups
Cultural bias: Western-centric training data
Mitigation: Diverse data, bias testing, debiasing techniques
What is model interpretability in NLP?

Attention visualization: Which words model focuses on
Gradient-based: Input attribution methods
Probing tasks: What linguistic knowledge models learn
Local explanations: LIME, SHAP for individual predictions
